title: QPU Architect
description: eleQtron develops and operates full-stack quantum computers based on trapped-ion technology. Responsibilities: lead compiler architecture, software optimisation, and HW/SW co-design; drive hardware-software co-design approach; performance analysis and optimization of quantum algorithms; define compute benchmarks; maintain technology roadmap; design/specify compiler front-end (quantum language), back-end (machine-specific) and optimization strategies; ensure clean, testable, scalable implementations. Required: Master’s in CS/physics/engineering; 3+ years industry/R&D in quantum computing; 3+ years Python/Rust/C++; working knowledge of Qiskit/Cirq; deep understanding of quantum computing paradigms/architectures and hardware realizations; expertise in quantum algorithms/compilers; strong grasp of quantum circuit design; knowledge of quantum error correction; excellent English. Valued: quantum compiler product experience; cross-functional HW/SW co-design; roadmap-impacting decisions.

title: Quantum Engineer
description: Pioneering deep-tech startup building the world’s most sensitive magnetic microscope. Responsibilities: develop and optimize high-resolution optical microscope; design/build/align/maintain complex optical setups (lasers, mirrors, active elements, imaging systems); use optical simulation software (e.g., Zemax); conduct quantum measurements on diamond-based sensors (magnetic field); develop experimental protocols to enhance sensitivity (goal 100x); offline data analysis on large datasets with Python or MATLAB; integrate optical/electronic/software components; troubleshoot complex physical effects and technical issues; contribute to system architecture. Qualifications: Master’s or PhD in Physics/Quantum Optics/Atomic Physics or related; hands-on experimental lab experience; expertise building/alignment of complex optical systems; strong analytical skills and data analysis in Python/MATLAB; proactive mindset. Advantage: Zemax; cold atoms/trapped ions/NV centers; high-resolution microscopy; AOM/AOD/SLM; microwave electronics/control.
